DataElement.preferredName: Dentist Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Treatment Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial No Participation Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to lack of dentist participation in study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups to evaluate treatments for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dentist Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Treatment Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial No Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to lack of dentist participation in study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups to evaluate treatments for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Concepts.definition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Property.preferredName: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Therapy Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial No Participation
Property.preferredDefinition: Any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups to evaluate treatments.  The study also includes a control group, which is undergoing the same rigors of the study with placebo treatment or standard treatment.  The trial can also be controlled by the addition of a test group to ensure there are no factors present to skew the results and by the inclusion of peer-review analysis by appropriate government officials. 2005:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: A disorder that affects the masticatory muscles and temporomandibular joint.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

A study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups to evaluate treatments.  The study also includes a control group, which is undergoing the same rigors of the study with placebo treatment or standard treatment.  The trial can also be controlled by the addition of a test group to ensure there are no factors present to skew the results and by the inclusion of peer-review analysis by appropriate government officials. 2005
The non-affirmative response to a question.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to protocol administration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
